column4: when i want install mercurial from synaptic this error show http://paste.ubuntu.com/305852/  what do i have to do?
you've mixed repositories or installed .deb's manually not intended for your version of ubuntu
now how can install mercurial?
well did you do any of the things I mentioned?
no
i can't understand your mean
pastebin the following: 1) the contents of your /etc/apt/sources.list* 2) the result of « sudo apt-get update && apt-cache policy python mercurial »
this is sources.list   http://paste.ubuntu.com/305867/
http://paste.ubuntu.com/305869/
lsb_release -c
jaunty
well why are your sources.list pointing to intrepid repos if you are running jaunty then?
do you understand?
yes myself change it
ok, why?  You need to use jaunty repos if you are on jaunty
for install mercurial j have to change sources.list
no, to have a working system you need to change your repositries to jaunty ones.  Once you do that, you should be able to install mercurial
i test with first repositries but it say not command find
show me what you actually did.  I don't understand what you just said
now how can i solve this problem ?  http://paste.ubuntu.com/305880/
did you change your repositories yet?  What is your new sources.list?
i don't change it
you need to change all the "intrepid" to "jaunty"
